docs.lead_paragraph:
Dozens of readers wrote to us with their company’s parental leave polices after reading the  Your Money column , which discussed how American public and private organizations offer the least generous paid leave policies in the world.
 
Some readers were stunned that even the largest companies offered so little paid time off, especially during a newborn’s critical early months when nursing can benefit both mother and child. Several Canadian readers, whose a country has a more liberal policy, chimed in with their thoughts and went as far as calling the American way barbaric. Other readers agonized about how to make sure their infants will be cared for when they return to work, while others viewed child care as the individual parent’s problem.

docs.abstract: Andrew Mason, the irreverent chief executive of Groupon, was ousted on Thursday. | Richard Schulze’s effort to take over Best Buy, the company he founded, has fallen apart. | Lanny A. Breuer, who spent four years running the Justice Department’s criminal division, is leaving his post on Friday. | One of Citigroup’s internal hedge funds is beginning a new life on Friday as an independent firm.

docs.abstract: It should not be impossible to restrain hospitals from charging so much, but few attempts have been made.

headline.main: In Helping a Brother, Fraternity Raises Awareness of Transgender Issues

docs.abstract: How did Donnie Collins’s fraternity brothers raise money to cover the cost of his top surgery, a procedure that is part of a female-to-male transgender transition?
